title: What are the minimum PC requirements to edit a 4K video? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on the application and the type of editing. For editing 4K UHD on FCPX, Apple recommends: 8 GB RAMOpen-CL or Metal2 capable graphics card or Intel HD3000 or later.Minimum 1 GB VRAM4 GB disk space (high-speed)For Premiere Pro CC on macOS, Adobe suggests: 8 GB RAM minimum (32 GB suggested)2 GB VRAM minimum (4GB suggested)8 GB disk space (high-speed)A graphics card from Adobe’s approved list (all of the discrete CPUs on Mac are included)Most PC 4K editing apps have similar suggested requirements to Adobe’s. FCPX generally requires less resources in so far as the architecture of the application itself is a little bit simpler and it relies more on OS frameworks that most other tools reimplement as a part of the app.

DaVinci Resolve 15 can do 4K and Puget Systems recommends: CPU: 8 cores or more, CPU frequency is more important than cores apparently?RAM: 32GB DDR4GPU: 8GB, Vega 56 or GTX 1070You can probably edit on 16GB with other software, but it might crawl?
